The NRR Strategy Framework

A Senior CSE Leader's Playbook

Primary Goal (The North Star)

Net Revenue Retention (NRR)

Why it matters: NRR is the ultimate business value metric. It captures both **retention** and **expansion**, making it the single metric that matters most to executive leadership.

The Three Pillars of Measurement

1. Leading Indicators

These move first when playbooks are active.

  • Engagement Score $\Delta$: Pre vs. post-playbook change.
  • Adoption Breadth/Depth: # of modules used; % of active users.
  • Time to Value (TTV): Speed of new feature adoption.
  • Playbook Execution Rate: % of flagged accounts followed up.
  • Time to Intervention: Speed of CSE response after score drops.
  • Efficiency: ARR protected / Churn prevented per CSE hour.
  • Customer Sentiment: NPS, CSAT, CES improvements.

The Bridge

NRR

Links CSE activity (Leading) to financial success (Lagging).

2. Lagging Indicators

These are realized later, tied to contract cycles.

  • Churn Rate / GRR: The ultimate measure of retention success.
  • Renewal Rate: By Logo count and by Dollar amount.
  • Expansion ARR: Cross-sell and Upsell revenue generated.

Strategic Framework: Predicting CSE Value

1

Build the Renewal Universe

Extract all accounts renewing in the next 3â€“6â€“12 months. Segment by Strat/Commercial/SMB. This becomes your **denominator** (ARR at Risk).

2

Map CSE Coverage & Load

Identify the CSE assigned to each account. Check accounts per CSE and **flag coverage gaps** (accounts without an active CSE).

3

Health Classification (Propensity)

Classify accounts into buckets using renewal models:

  • ðŸŸ¢ **Green:** High likelihood to renew (Focus on expansion).
  • ðŸŸ  **Orange:** At-risk but recoverable with intervention.
  • ðŸ”´ **Red:** Likely churn without structural change.
4

Churn Attribution (Focus the Effort)

Separate churn risk into two types. **CSE Productivity can only influence the Non-Structural bucket.**

  • **Structural Churn:** Unavoidable (e.g., Acquisition, Sunset).
  • **Non-Structural Churn:** Addressable via CSE action (Adoption, ROI proof, Exec relationships).
5

Model the "Lift" from Interventions

Establish baseline CSE productivity (e.g., avg. churn prevention, expansion \$ generated). Apply a **lift factor** to *Orange/Red non-structural* accounts:

  • Example: **Red** Non-Structural $\rightarrow$ 20% Save Rate.
  • Example: **Orange** Non-Structural $\rightarrow$ 40% Save Rate.
6

Translate to $ Impact

Multiply the "lift-adjusted" save rates by the ARR at risk in those buckets. The sum is your **Value Creation Forecast** from deploying engagement-driven playbooks.
